error.signature: Error [ERR_HTTP_HEADERS_SENT]: Cannot set headers after they are sent to the client
error.regex: ERR_HTTP_HEADERS_SENT.*Cannot set headers after they are sent

verdict.summary: Response already sent but code tries to send again. Missing return after res.send().

dead_ends.action: Add res.headersSent check before every response
dead_ends.why_fails: Doesn't fix the control flow bug â€” just hides it
The error is a logic bug, not an exception to catch

workarounds.action: Add return after res.send()/res.json()/res.redirect() to prevent further execution
Check for multiple middleware calling next() and also sending response
workarounds.how: Use return after res.send()/res.json() to prevent double-response

frequently_confused_with.distinction: '[ERR_HTTP_HEADERS_SENT]' indicates headers sent after response already started, while 'Error' indicates a port already in use.
'[ERR_HTTP_HEADERS_SENT]' indicates headers sent after response already started, while '[ERR_INVALID_PACKAGE_CONFIG]' indicates an invalid package.json configuration.
